job_description:
Our client is a Fortune Global 100 member and worldwide leader in the ICT space. They are currently growing out a new R&D group focused on embedded real time operating system development and seeking multiple candidates for a challenging role developing the real-time OS for embedded systems and IOT devices. Requires 5 or more years experience in Linux kernel programming (ideally in C/C++) and knowledge of CPU architecture.

Today, the our client's OS Kernel Lab aims to study and develop a next-generation OS kernel architecture to support and address the growing demands of advanced hardware platforms such as embedded devices, cloud & virtualised servers, automotive telematics and more!. The demands for even more low latency, high security, strong reliability and adaption though intelligence will drive our research and development to focus on these areas. Additionally, as one of the top 3 contributors to the Linux kernel for multiple releases we also contribute back to the open source community while providing a stable and high efficiency support for our client's ICT products.

Exploring the real-time OS research or development targeting embedded devices, cloud & virtualized computing and automotive domain.
Contribute and help build the next-generation real-time OS technology to power a broad range of compute platforms
Solve some very challenging problems around scheduling, resource allocation, isolation and IPC in very complex systems use cases
Focus on developing tooling and solutions to performance challenges in the system
